entityId.localType: State Library of Western Australia Call Number

nameEntry.part: Western Australian Foundation for Deaf Children, records

biogHist.abstract: 'Western Australian Foundation for Deaf Children, records' is a collection of records from the West Australian Deaf and Dumb Institution, the West Australian School for the Deaf and Dumb and the WA School for Deaf Children. These are held in the Battye Library's Private Archives Collection.There are students' reports, files and medical records, organisational records, diaries and correspondence in the collection, which includes a list of 'restricted files' (at 7576A/32) and a 'register of pupils' dated 1897-1956 (at 7576A/29).
biogHist.p: Please contact the State Library to request access to this collection as the items are held in storage. To protect the privacy of individuals, access restrictions may apply to some records.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: West Australian Foundation for Deaf Children (Inc.) (2004 - )

descriptiveNote.p: The West Australian Foundation for Deaf Children (Inc) is the inheritor of the history and legacy of the West Australian Deaf and Dumb Institution, the West Australian School for the Deaf and Dumb and the WA School for Deaf Children.
